relationships.evidence_text: Welcome to the Why On Earth Community Podcast. I'm your host, Aaron William Perry.
Ben Raskin, the author of the Woodchip Handbook, a complete guide for farmers, gardeners and land scapers.
Ben Raskin has worked in horticulture for more than 25 years.

relationships.target: growers at all levels of production
relationships.evidence_text: As head of horticulture and agroforestry for the soil association, he provides growers at all levels of production with technical marketing policy, supply chain and networking support.

evidence.target_surface: growers at all levels of production

relationships.evidence_text: He is currently implementing a 200 acre silver pastoral agroforestry planting in Wiltshire, England.
Ben is the author of several previous books on gardening, including zero waste gardening and the community gardening handbook.
Additionally, Ben co-chairs the Defra Edibles horticulture round table.
sits on the board of the organic growers alliance.
sits on the board of the community supported agriculture network UK.
which of course is published by Chelsea Green publishing.
